If Sheryl Lee Ralph‚Äôs current awards season sweep (i.e., her Critics‚Äô Choice Award and Emmy speeches) are any indication of what‚Äôs to come, viewers are in for a great performance. The Tony nominee‚Äôs sing-and-dance background goes back decades to her early Broadway days, including her breakthrough performance as the original Deena Jones in the original production of Dreamgirls. Viewers have seen Ralph‚Äôs inner showgirl emerge several times through her TV and film performances, most notably her time on the classic CBS sitcom Designing Women. However, her Dreamgirls moment with fellow Emmy winner Jennifer Hudson already gave audiences a sneak preview of what we'll get during the big game.

The pre-game show is just as packed as the halftime performance. It is currently unknown how many of her hits Rihanna will perform during the 13-minute show. Like previous Super Bowl halftime performances, fans won‚Äôt know anything about the setlist until the big day.
